data.text:
They are referred to as "notified bodies" under EU legislation because they are notified to the European Commission by being entered in the "NANDO" official register.

In the case of railway interoperability, the reference legislation is Directive 2016/797/EU.

Italcertifer, as a notified body, is accountable to the competent national authority as it takes on responsibilities in sectors of public interest and in an area, which has a direct impact on the safety of EU citizens.

Italcertifer activity as a Notified Body (NoBo) involves the assessment of railway subsystems and interoperability constituents in order to certify their compliance with the Technical Specifications for Interoperability (TSI) and issue the relative "EC Verification Certificates".
